questions_and_answers.q: The mean of one set of five numbers is 13, and the mean of a separate set of six numbers is 24.  What is the mean of the set of all eleven numbers?
What is the value of x in the equation `9^4+9^4+9^4=3^x?`
Two complementary angles are in a ratio of 3:2. What is the measure, in degrees, of the smaller angle?
In a certain dormitory, there are 72 rooms for 131 students. If each room is occupied by either one or two students, how many rooms are occupied by just one student?
You can trade 7 beeps for 3 bops and you can trade 4 bops for 5 dings.  How many beeps would you need to be able to trade for 60 dings?
What is the area, in square units, of a circle with a circumference of 8*π units? Express your answer in terms of π

The sum of the digits of a two-digit positive integer is seven. Subtracting 45 from this integer yields another two digit integer with the same digits, but in reversed order.  What is the original integer?
What is the largest integer that is less than the square root of 250?
Jordan ran 2 miles in half the time it took Steve to run 3 miles. If it took Steve 24 minutes to run 3 miles. using the same rates, how many minutes would it take to Jordan to run 5 miles?

Hadley scored 92, 73, 79, and 87 points on the first four tests of the quarter. There is one test remaining. What is the minimum number of points that Hadley must score in order to have a mean of 80 points for the five tests?

A freshly painted circular emblem on a football field is completely covered by the smallest possible tarp. The tarp covers an area of 196 square feet. In square feet, what is the area of the circular emblem? Express your answer in terms of π.
What is the sum of the distinct prime factors of 315?
The sum of the numerator and the denominator of a fraction is 216. The fraction is equivalent to two-sevenths. What is the value of the denominator?
What is the sum of the first 10 odd positive integers?
A square region with side length 1 foot is covered completely with 2-inch by 2-inch square stickers. How many of the stickers are needed to cover the region exactly without overlap?
Two triangles are similar. The ratio of their areas is 1:4. If the height of the smaller triangle is 3 cm, how long is the corresponding height of the larger triangle, in centimeters?

Wilma has 3 red pens, 3 blue pens, 4 black pens and 5 green pens in her school bag. If she randomly selects on pen from her bag, what is the probability that she selects a green pen? Express your answer as a common fraction.
How many positive integers, x, satisfy x - 4 < 3?
Zachary paid for $1 burger with 32 coins and received no change. Each coin was either a penny or a nickel. What was the number of nickels that Zachary used?

The sum of three consecutive one-digit, positive, odd integers is one-seventh of the product of the same three integers. What is the middle integer when the three integers are listed in ascending order?
A regular hexagon is divided into six congruent equilateral triangles. If the perimeter of one of the triangles is 39 inches, what is the perimeter of the regular hexagon, in inches?

Kyle has five tires but only uses four at a time on his car. He has rotated the five tires on his car so that each tire has been on the car for the same number of miles. If the car has driven 90,000 miles, for how many miles was each of the five tires on the car?
Each of the digits 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, and 9 is used once and only once to form a six-digit integer. What is the largest six-digit multiple of 4 that can be formed?
How many cubic feet are in three cubic yards?
In the six-digit integer 3A6,792, what is the largest digit A so that the six-digit integer will be divisible by 3?
A regular polygon has exterior angles each measuring 15 degrees. How many sides does the polygon have?
If A = `1/4` and B = `-1/2`, what is the absolute value of the difference between 18A and 18B? Express your answer as a decimal to the nearest tenth.

In a spelling bee 50% of the students were eliminated after the first round. Only `1/3` of the remaining students were still in the contest after the second round. If 24 students were still in the contest after the second round, how many students began the competition?
What is the smallest positive integer with factors of 16, 15, and 12?
Point A has coordinates (x,6). When point A is reflected over the y-axis it land on point B.  What is the sum of the four coordinate values of points A and B?
An equilateral triangle and a square have equal perimeters. The side of the triangle measures 8 cm. What is the area of the square, in square centimeters?
Isaac wrote the integers from 1 through 104, inclusive. How many digits did he write?
What is 20% of `1/4` of 120?

Each day Siggy The Squirrel gathers 20 nuts and eats 14 nuts. If Siggy is starting June with 0 nuts, after how many consecutive days of collecting and eating nuts will he have enough nuts to eat until the end of June without collecting any additional nuts?
The measures of the angles of a triangle are in a ratio of 3:5:7. What is the degree measure of the largest angle?
The product of two consecutive positive integers is 380. What is the sum of the two integers?
What multiple of 15 is closest to 2009?
The width, length, and height of a rectangular prism are each increased by 10%. What is the percent increase in the volume of the prism? Express your answer to the nearest whole number.
What is the 5th term of an arithmetic sequence of 20 terms with first and last terms of 2 and 59, respectively?

Khalil has to shovel snow off the sidewalk in front of his house. The sidewalk is 20 ft. long and 2 ft. wide. If the snow is `1/2` ft. deep, how many cubic feet of snow does Khalil have to shovel off the sidewalk?
